channel.title: ::pickup

item.title: ::pickup
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Open the file Item.java.
Look for the arrays.
They should look like this;

   public static boolean[] itemStackable = new boolean[10000];
   public static boolean[] itemIsNote = new boolean[10000];
   public static boolean[] itemTwoHanded = new boolean[10000];
   public static boolean[] itemTradeable = new boolean[10000];
   public static boolean[] itemSellable = new boolean[10000];

Increase the size from 10,000 to 20,000.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pickup

item.description:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:5, topic:390801”][quote author=fatboy9112003 link=topic=486743.msg3566968#msg3566968 date=1302729948]
try do ::item if not hit me up on adampayne16@hotmail.com
[/quote]

wtf is this like your 5th account?!?!?
Hey guys I can help add my msn @ ad...@hotmail.com tired of seeing that is your response to everything.[/quote]

Lmfao…

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:6, topic:390801”]You’re probably getting an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException…

Make sure that in the Item class you increase all the array sizes from 10,000 to 20,000.[/quote]

He is probally right to, a lot of people are having problems with their spawning commands because of this for some reason :rolleyes:

item.title: ::pickup
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

It’s pickup, not item lol. Try doing

::pickup (item id here) (amount)

Like

::pipckup 11694 1 <-- Arma gs, or try without the 1 in the end.

item.title: ::pickup
item.dc:creator: @demolish1 demolish1
item.description:
@demolish1 wrote:

forsome reason when i do ::pickup item how much it keeps saying this cmon try it again here is the codes for it
what do i do

    }

if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));
if (newItemID <= 20000 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sendMessage(“That Item Doesn’t Exist”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! ");
}
}

Read full topic
